page.title: 04The Gipsy Site.
page.content: There is a{Gypsy site}along the Amersham Road.At present there are four cars under repair on the site as well as nine caravans.The mud covered site is untidy and besieged by stinging nettles and thistles. The Gypsies previously lived on a site in Gerrards Cross but were ordered to leave and moved to their present site.This was for a period of six weeks only,they have,however,been at the present site for a year. At Gerrards Cross they paid Â£10 a week for the site which had toilets,showers and hot and cold running water.At the latter site they pay Â£8 per week for cold water only. For showers and baths they travel into Slough,the nearest town. The situation seems desperate as living conditions are squalid.They would like to return to the old site.
